events.message: Customer reported a car collision that happened at an intersection, causing visible damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident as it involves vehicle collision and property damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim and reach out to the customer for further details.
The customer was sent an acknowledgement email confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and next steps.
The agent requested photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and driver's license to proceed with investigation.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including police report and vehicle repair estimate promptly.
Investigation began on the circumstances of the accident, including verification of submitted documents and third-party reports.
All necessary checks were completed without discrepancies; claim considered valid based on evidence reviewed.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount covering the full cost of vehicle repairs and related expenses.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the timely communication from the agent handling the case.
The claim was formally approved by the claims department following customer acceptance of the settlement offer.
The payment for the approved claim amount was issued to the customer's bank account within the expected timeframe.
The auto accident claim was closed after finalizing all payments and confirming customer satisfaction with the resolution.
